Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments) of local, pottery amphora; exterior: two bands and glazed area below shoulder zone on which part of one broad diagonal is preserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The piece is mentioned by Petrie as an example of the pieces of ‘earliest pottery from well [in the Apollo sanctuary] with retrograde inscriptions’ in his fabric group B1 (Petrie 1886a, 17, pl. 33.4). Unlikely to be from same vase as 1886,0401.82a-b, but close in fabric.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 4)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 642, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.01)
